treatment.description: Irregular cocci; cell width 1.3 µm. Cells are peritrichously flagellated. Gram-negative; sensitive to 1% SDS. Cell wall has a periodic surface pattern. Colony characteristics: Circular, convex, yellow with entire edges and a shiny surface. DNA base composition: 61 mol % G + C. Temperature optimum 20- 25˚C. pH optimum 6.2 to 6.6. Isolated from sediment from the Black Sea. Fastidious anaerobe; formate or H2-CO2 serve as substrates for growth and methane production; acetate and methanol do not. Optimal growth at 0.19M Na+; Trypticase required for growth. Type strain: JR1. DSM number 1498 Gottingen, FRG. The description of the type strain is the same as for the species.
